subject: Education
title: Interference: When Memories Block Each Other
description: One-minute skill: Interference: When Memories Block Each Other.

hook.text: You learned Spanish, then French. Now you accidentally say 'merci' in Spain.

buildup.text: Interference occurs when similar memories compete for retrieval at the same time.

discovery.text: Proactive interference: old memories block new. Retroactive: new memories block old.

twist.text: Sleeping between learning sessions dramatically reduces interference between competing memories.

climax.text: Distinct encoding contextsâ€”different rooms, times, moodsâ€”help keep similar memories separate.

punchline.text: Forgetting isn't always decay. Sometimes memories fight each other.

quiz.question: What is retroactive interference?
options: New memories disrupting the retrieval of older ones
Old memories preventing new ones from forming
Two memories merging into a single false memory
